Teamwork makes the stream work.
Roku is changing how the world watches TV
Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the US, and we've set our sights on powering every television in the world. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers.
From your first day at Roku, you'll make a valuable - and valued - contribution. We're a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers around the world while gaining meaningful experience across a variety of disciplines.

What we do
At Civis Analytics, we bring objective, data-driven truth to organizational decision-making—from the boardroom to the world's largest social causes.
This mission isn't an aspiration: it's something we see realized every day, and it brings purpose to everything we're working on.
We combine a sophisticated SaaS product with our specialized data science consultancy to empower tens of thousands of active users to make millions of data-driven decisions every month. From joining disparate data sources and automating reporting, to building more elaborate models of targeted audiences and optimizing messages for them, organizations like the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, the City of Boston, and iHeart Radio trust Civis's technology to make their most critical decisions.

Discover. A brighter future.
With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day & We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.
Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.

Discord is looking for experienced and passionate data scientist to join our mighty Data Science team! As a member of the Data Science team, you will help Discord achieve its mission of being the best place to hang out, by collaborating directly with the teams who design, build, and support Discord. We're specifically hiring for the Communities Data Science team, and this individual will focus primarily on the Moderator Tools space. Moderator Tools are a vital part of Discord - with the diverse needs of Moderators across so many different types of servers, you'd partner closely with Product, UX, Engineering, and other cross-functional teams to evolve how these tools benefit a very important contributor to the Discord ecosystem. What You'll Be Doing Partner with teams through the full lifecycle of data analytics from ideation and exploratory analysis, to building dashboards and reports Define KPIs and diagnostic metrics that help improve the user experience, encapsulating these measures in clean crisp dashboards that provide the company with timely and actionable information Use our amazing infrastructure to quickly and easily build custom data sets to monitor novel product features and processes Proactively socialize insights, dashboards, and reports with technical and non-technical audiences, soliciting feedback on where to improve Be a champion of A/B testing and help groups throughout the company design, analyze, and interpret A/B tests correctly Collaborate with data and engineering teams to design scalable and future-proof instrumentation You Will Thrive In This Role If 4+ years of experience autonomously translating ambiguous business problems into deep informative insights through hands-on analytics 4+ years of experience building performant dashboards using Tableau, Looker, or similar software - with proficiency in designing clean crisp visualizations 3+ years experience writing excellent SQL Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complicated findings or technical approaches in easy-to-understand ways 2+ years of experience in the design, analysis, and interpretation of A/B tests in a large data environment A desire to work with amazing, passionate people who care deeply about solve challenging problems to improve Discord Last but not least - a collaborative attitude and a healthy dose of natural curiosity! Bonus Points Passion for Discord or online communities Experience with writing production ETL Experience with technical leadership, being the point person for one or more stakeholder groups Experience with analytics for social media or international subscription-based online services, including familiarity with concepts such as social graphs, LTV/user-lifecycle analysis, funnel analysis, etc Experience writing performant code in BigQuery SQL The US base salary range for this full-time position is $178,000 to $192,000 + equity + benefits. Job Title: Signal Processing and Machine Learning Engineer
Job Description:
Signal Systems Corporation (SSC) is searching for Machine Learning Engineers to support the development of next generation sonar systems and sonar signal processing algorithms for a range of underwater applications. Build large datasets, test machine learning models, and incorporate trained models into larger software products.

DATA SCIENTIST/ALGORITHM DEVELOPER
Raptor Scientific, a Global Aerospace & Defense Test and Measurement Company, is seeking an exceptional Engineer or Applied Mathematician with expertise in signal processing to join our dynamic team. You will have the opportunity to work on challenging projects that demand a deep understanding of signal processing algorithms and imaging techniques. Your expertise in handling I/Q data and proficiency in programming languages such as C, C#, and MATLAB will be instrumental in driving our technological advancements. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in developing and optimizing advanced technologies that will enhance the performance and capabilities of our mission-critical aerospace and defense systems.
As part of the Raptor Scientific Family, the RF Systems (RFS) group specializes in radar cross section (RCS) measurements and is constantly innovating to produce the next generation of radar systems. RFS has a multifaceted team that develops cutting edge measurement systems in support of the Aerospace and Defense industry. Our team is focused on customer needs and providing full spectrum support including engineering, field measurement, software development and manufacturing.

About Us:
At Parafin, our mission is to grow small businesses. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, yet banks do not have their back. Parafin is a technology company that builds infrastructure which enables small businesses to get easy access to financial services via platforms they sell on.

Parafin's first product offers capital-as-a-service for online platforms. Parafin currently powers the capital programs of platforms ranging from Series B to post-IPO companies such as DoorDash, Amazon, and Worldpay. We are a tight-knit team of engineers and designers, coming from organizations such as Stripe, Square, Plaid, Coinbase, Robinhood, Affirm, Uber, and CERN, and are excited both about helping hundreds of thousands of small businesses grow and thrive, and building products that leaders at top companies have started to use every day.

We are backed by prominent venture capitalists such as Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, GIC, Index Ventures, Green Oaks Capital, and SV Angel.

The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will support the Department of State (DOS) Center for Analytics (CfA) in a dynamic role that may evolve over time, as the organizational needs change. The DOS Chief Data Scientist has a broad set of responsibilities and duties that require support from a professional and technical staff, of which the Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist a senior member. The primary responsibility of the Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will be to support the Chief Data Scientist as advisor, subject matter expert, and surrogate in meetings, working groups, and technical environments. The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will evaluate data science projects, provide recommendations and improvements to the Chief Data Scientist and/or analytics project staff, working closely with them to implement improvements as necessary.
The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will evaluate, recommend, and support the implementation of technology stack and software toolset optimizations and additions. The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist lead or independently execute analytics projects, as needed. The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will provide expert input on Large Language Models (LLM), Natural Language Processing (NLP), Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML), data science models, and other technical topics.

Description
Come join our exceptional Department of Neurobiology, and help lead the advancement of cutting-edge basic science research into explorations of the brain and central nervous system. Our research team, the Theoretical and Computational Neuroscience Laboratory (www.dipoppalab.com), is a cooperative and vibrant environment where all members are offered excellent scientific training and career mentoring. We are looking for candidates with a keen interest in gaining research experience in Computational Neuroscience, pursuing research projects, and supporting those of other team members. The Data Scientist will develop code (primarily in Python using libraries such as numpy, scikit-learn, pytorch) to support research in computational neuroscience pursued in the laboratory as well as working on their own research project. This work will include submitting jobs to high-performance computing clusters, analyzing large-scale biological and simulated datasets using machine learning tools, and training artificial neural network models. UCLA Health is a world-renowned health system with four award-winning hospitals and dozens of primary care practices, specialty practices, urgent care centers and other ancillary locations throughout metro Los Angeles as well as the David Geffen School of Medicine, which is an internationally-respected center of advanced medical education and research. EDA assistance is available to rural and urban areas of the Nation experiencing high unemployment, low income, or other severe economic distress. Machine Learning Engineer
About CoVar
CoVar is a small AI/ML R&D software company in Durham, NC, that uses artificial intelligence to solve problems that matter. We develop AI/ML tools to help the DoD detect enemies and threats, help biomedical researchers find new cures for diseases, and help monitor machinery to prevent injuries and environmental catastrophes. We are passionate engineers, dedicated to pushing the bounds of what AI/ML can do in the real world.
About this position
You will help CoVar develop software and machine learning algorithms to solve real-world customer problems. You will work with data, develop algorithms, evaluate results, and write the production code that goes onto real-world systems. You will have the opportunity to present your work to high-level customers in the DoD and in the industry. The position includes opportunities to publish novel work in both classified and unclassified settings.

Applicants should have expertise in Python (including NumPy, pandas, and other packages) and either PyTorch or TensorFlow. Deep understanding of machine learning fundamentals (gradient descent, cross-validation, ROC curves, confusion matrices) are necessary. Knowledge of classical machine learning (e.g., support-vector-machines, logistic regression) are valued. Applicants are ideally familiar with computer vision algorithms like object detection networks (e.g., YOLO, CenterNet) and modern image classification techniques. Previous experience with DoD customers is a plus.

Job Title: Sr. Data Scientist- Consumer Deposits & Small Business
Job Description:
Boston, United States of America

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

In this role, you can expect to:
Be a strategic partner to Product, Pricing and Finance leadership, developing analytical solutions, robust business cases and product / business strategy proposals in line with business objectives

Provide analytics support across lifecycle initiatives: customer and deposit acquisition, pricing, customer engagement and lifetime value optimization and portfolio / risk management

Develop predictive analytics, customer segmentation approaches and hypothesis-driven data deliverables for continuous process and business optimization

Be able to influence executives and business partners with compelling narratives and dashboards reporting

Proactively research opportunities for profitable growth and engage the right technical and/or business partners to develop meaningful action plans ensuring compliance with all policies, laws and regulations.

Have a test and learn mentality and employ problem solving frameworks and big-picture thinking to translate both ambiguous and tactical business queries into analytical deliverables, aligned to strategic goals

Partner closely with data scientists and data engineers to analyze complex data from disparate systems, implement analytics solutions and evangelize data best practices


Master's Degree in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics or similar);

5-7 years progressive experience with data mining/advanced analytics; Prior experience with Retail Banking (Required) in a role supporting Consumer Deposits, Small Business, Payments, Pricing or Investments (Preferred)

Demonstrated experience with data exploration, hypothesis creation, algorithm testing, and scaling to large datasets

Proficient using SAS, SQL and one other programming language (Python, R etc) and ability to adapt to various programming languages and environments; Experience working with AWS and Snowflake preferred

Ability to conceptualize and execute analytical work based on broad business objectives, build strategic and analytical frameworks and articulate business impact

Advanced knowledge of and breadth of analytic methodologies - statistics & machine learning - e.g. linear and non-linear regression, logistic regression, clustering (k-means, EM, Mean-shift), classification algorithms, decision trees, ensembles (bagging, boosting, rand)

Ability to work with large scale data to derive insights through data analysis, optimization or risk classification algorithms and communicate results to Executives and non-technical audiences

Individually motivated, strong business acumen and quantitative / problem-solving skills with a focus on delivery in a fast-paced environment.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills and comfort partnering with leadership

The base annual salary range for this position is $105,125-$175,000. The exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, training, licensure and certifications and location. Bachelor of Science (BS) English

Machine Learning Engineer
About CoVar
CoVar is a small AI/ML R&D software company in Durham, NC, that uses artificial intelligence to solve problems that matter. We develop AI/ML tools to help the DoD detect enemies and threats, help biomedical researchers find new cures for diseases, and help monitor machinery to prevent injuries and environmental catastrophes. We are passionate engineers, dedicated to pushing the bounds of what AI/ML can do in the real world.
About this position
You will help CoVar develop software and machine learning algorithms to solve real-world customer problems. You will work with data, develop algorithms, evaluate results, and write the production code that goes onto real-world systems. You will have the opportunity to present your work to high-level customers in the DoD and in the industry. The position includes opportunities to publish novel work in both classified and unclassified settings.

Applicants should have expertise in Python (including NumPy, pandas, and other packages) and either PyTorch or TensorFlow. Deep understanding of machine learning fundamentals (gradient descent, cross-validation, ROC curves, confusion matrices) are necessary. Knowledge of classical machine learning (e.g., support-vector-machines, logistic regression) are valued. Applicants are ideally familiar with computer vision algorithms like object detection networks (e.g., YOLO, CenterNet) and modern image classification techniques. Previous experience with DoD customers is a plus.

The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will support the Department of State (DOS) Center for Analytics (CfA) in a dynamic role that may evolve over time, as the organizational needs change. The DOS Chief Data Scientist has a broad set of responsibilities and duties that require support from a professional and technical staff, of which the Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist a senior member. The primary responsibility of the Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will be to support the Chief Data Scientist as advisor, subject matter expert, and surrogate in meetings, working groups, and technical environments. The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will evaluate data science projects, provide recommendations and improvements to the Chief Data Scientist and/or analytics project staff, working closely with them to implement improvements as necessary.
The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will evaluate, recommend, and support the implementation of technology stack and software toolset optimizations and additions. The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist lead or independently execute analytics projects, as needed. The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will provide expert input on Large Language Models (LLM), Natural Language Processing (NLP), Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML), data science models, and other technical topics.

WCE DATA SCIENTIST

Job Summary

WCE - Data Scientist is responsible for the development of technologies focused on data analytics, CBM and PHM for drilling and pressure control equipment within the Well Construction division. The Data Scientist is expected to lead the development of computational algorithms and models, provide a mathematical description of the performance of the equipment, health indicators, failure modes and remaining useful life, and then work directly with software engineers to industrialize these models and algorithms. Work with original equipment manufacturers (OEM) subject matter experts (SME) to understand the design and operation of well construction equipment.

Roles and Responsibilities

Work with equipment operators and service organizations internal and external to understand the performance and maintenance of well construction equipment.

Collect, curate, label and analyze equipment data (manufacturing, operation, services, etc) to develop insight for improvement of equipment performance and maintenance.

Develop mathematical models and algorithms to evaluate the conditions of drilling and pressure control equipment and validate these models and algorithms with SMEs and in field tests.

Apply machine learning and data analytics techniques when needed to create or improve the RUL models or address any gaps in the fundamental understanding of equipment.

Build and maintain data structures and databases with a particular emphasis on time-series data.

Produce data visualizations to demonstrate learnings and opportunities that support a wide range of stakeholders.

Work with external customers to demonstrate the value of CBM for total cost of ownership.

Create and maintain project documentation.

Minimum Job Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Applied Science, Engineering or similar disciplines.
Strong skills in data cleaning, data quality assessment, and using analytics for data assessment.
3+ years of experience in developing physics-based simulation models and anomaly detection.
Familiar with data analytics tools, relevant programming languages such as C# or Python and technologies like SQL, NoSQL, Spark, etc.
Knowledge of Agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Experience working with and maintaining CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Azure DevOp
Candidates must be able to legally work and reside in the US, without sponsorship.

Preferred Qualifications

Self-starter, require minimal supervision. Team player, capable of working with people of different technical and non-technical background.

Excellent communication skills, capable of presenting technical solutions to people with different technical background.

Team Description

Our Product team advocates for our users and our business, setting the vision for our growing family of products. We use data, research, strategy, and empathy to guide multidisciplinary teams toward a common goal, balancing diverse perspectives and empowering our teams to do great work. As we scale globally, there’s plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people around the world in team that always focuses on we, not I, and creates delightful products that are worthy of trust.

Role Description

We're looking for a Data Scientist to partner with revenue, marketing, and product teams to answer key questions about how to grow revenue, optimize product, scale and monetize the business, and launch high-impact initiatives. We solve challenging problems and boost business growth through a deep understanding of user behaviors with applied analytics techniques and business insights. An ideal candidate should have robust knowledge of consumer lifecycle and behavior analysis, customer segmentation, digital campaigns, monetization analytics and business operations for a SaaS company.
Responsibilities

Develop a deep understanding of customer journey phases and key business metrics
Perform analytical deep-dives to analyze problems and opportunities, identify the hypothesis and design & execute experiments
Inform future experimentation design and roadmaps by performing exploratory analysis to understand user engagement behavior and derive insights
Create personalized segmentation strategies leveraging propensity models to enable targeting of offers and experiences based on user attributes
Identify key trends and build automated reporting & executive-facing dashboards to track the progress of acquisition, monetization, and engagement trends.
Extract actionable insights through analyzing large, complex, multi-dimensional customer behavior data sets
Monitor and analyze a high volume of experiments designed to optimize the product for user experience and revenue & promote best practices for multivariate experiments
Translate complex concepts into implications for the business via excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Understand what matters most and prioritize ruthlessly
Work with cross-functional teams (including Data Science, Marketing, Product, Engineering, Design, User Research, and senior executives) to rapidly execute and iterate
Requirements

Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
3-5 years experience using analytics to drive key business decisions; examples include business/product/marketing analytics, business intelligence, strategy consulting
Proven track record of being able to work independently and proactively engage with business stakeholders with minimal direction
Significant experience with SQL and large unstructured datasets such as Hadoop
Deep understanding of statistical analysis, experimentation design, and common analytical techniques like regression, decision trees
Solid background in running multivariate experiments to optimize a product or revenue flow
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in programming/scripting and knowledge of statistical packages like R or Python is a plus

Total Rewards

Machine Learning Engineer
About CoVar
CoVar is a small AI/ML R&D software company in Durham, NC, that uses artificial intelligence to solve problems that matter. We develop AI/ML tools to help the DoD detect enemies and threats, help biomedical researchers find new cures for diseases, and help monitor machinery to prevent injuries and environmental catastrophes. We are passionate engineers, dedicated to pushing the bounds of what AI/ML can do in the real world.
About this position
You will help CoVar develop software and machine learning algorithms to solve real-world customer problems. You will work with data, develop algorithms, evaluate results, and write the production code that goes onto real-world systems. You will have the opportunity to present your work to high-level customers in the DoD and in the industry. The position includes opportunities to publish novel work in both classified and unclassified settings.

Applicants should have expertise in Python (including NumPy, pandas, and other packages) and either PyTorch or TensorFlow. Deep understanding of machine learning fundamentals (gradient descent, cross-validation, ROC curves, confusion matrices) are necessary. Knowledge of classical machine learning (e.g., support-vector-machines, logistic regression) are valued. Applicants are ideally familiar with computer vision algorithms like object detection networks (e.g., YOLO, CenterNet) and modern image classification techniques. Previous experience with DoD customers is a plus.

WCE DATA SCIENTIST

Job Summary

WCE - Data Scientist is responsible for the development of technologies focused on data analytics, CBM and PHM for drilling and pressure control equipment within the Well Construction division. The Data Scientist is expected to lead the development of computational algorithms and models, provide a mathematical description of the performance of the equipment, health indicators, failure modes and remaining useful life, and then work directly with software engineers to industrialize these models and algorithms. Work with original equipment manufacturers (OEM) subject matter experts (SME) to understand the design and operation of well construction equipment.

Roles and Responsibilities

Work with equipment operators and service organizations internal and external to understand the performance and maintenance of well construction equipment.

Collect, curate, label and analyze equipment data (manufacturing, operation, services, etc) to develop insight for improvement of equipment performance and maintenance.

Develop mathematical models and algorithms to evaluate the conditions of drilling and pressure control equipment and validate these models and algorithms with SMEs and in field tests.

Apply machine learning and data analytics techniques when needed to create or improve the RUL models or address any gaps in the fundamental understanding of equipment.

Build and maintain data structures and databases with a particular emphasis on time-series data.

Produce data visualizations to demonstrate learnings and opportunities that support a wide range of stakeholders.

Work with external customers to demonstrate the value of CBM for total cost of ownership.

Create and maintain project documentation.

Minimum Job Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Applied Science, Engineering or similar disciplines.
Strong skills in data cleaning, data quality assessment, and using analytics for data assessment.
3+ years of experience in developing physics-based simulation models and anomaly detection.
Familiar with data analytics tools, relevant programming languages such as C# or Python and technologies like SQL, NoSQL, Spark, etc.
Knowledge of Agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Experience working with and maintaining CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Azure DevOp
Candidates must be able to legally work and reside in the US, without sponsorship.

Preferred Qualifications

Self-starter, require minimal supervision. Team player, capable of working with people of different technical and non-technical background.

Excellent communication skills, capable of presenting technical solutions to people with different technical background.

You will enjoy an intellectually creative atmosphere as you work with an experienced and enthusiastic team that strives continuously to build and deliver a robust, reliable software system.

Job Title: Device Analytics Data Scientist Fall 2023 Co-op
Job Description:
Company Overview
At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.

As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.

At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.

The Device Analytics Cloud Services (DACS) team is a critical part of the Device Cloud Engineering department at Motorola Solutions. As a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to work on an innovative analytics platform that is capable of analyzing billions of records each month from cloud connected devices. The DACs team is responsible for developing and maintaining this powerful platform, which provides actionable insights to help our clients make informed decisions and optimize their operations. As a member of the DACs team, you will work with a talented and dynamic group of professionals to build, test, and deploy this cutting-edge platform. If you are passionate about working on the forefront of technology and making a real difference in the world, the Device Analytics Cloud Service team is the perfect place for you.

The Position
WHO WE ARE
Our Strategic Analytics & Intelligence (SAI) team isn’t just deciphering data. We’re here to help solve the world’s most complex healthcare challenges and improve the lives of patients.
With a mix of competitive intelligence, market research, data science, advanced analytics, access, and forecasting, SAI unlocks key insights for our internal partners that ultimately benefit healthcare providers and patients. Even if you’ve never worked in biotech, you’ll establish yourself as an expert alongside other specialists. Plus, you can gain new experiences across marketing disciplines, therapeutic areas, and commercial operations. The entire time, you’ll be surrounded by a diverse and inclusive team that aims to reflect the world we serve.

Company Description

Dropbox is a special place where we are all seeking to fulfill our mission to design a more enlightened way of working. We’re looking for innovative talent to join us on our journey. The words shared by our founders at the start of Dropbox still ring true today.

Wouldn’t it be great if our working environment—and the tools we use—were designed with people’s actual needs in mind? Imagine if every minute at work were well spent—if we could focus and spend our time on the things that matter. This is possible, and Dropbox is connecting the dots.

The nearly 3,000 Dropboxers around the world have helped make Dropbox a living workspace - the place where people come together and their ideas come to life. Our 700+ million global users have been some of our best salespeople, and they have helped us acquire customers with incredible efficiency. As a result, we reached a billion dollar revenue run rate faster than any software-as-a-service company in history.

Dropbox is making the dream of a fulfilling and seamless work life a reality. We hope you’ll join us on the journey.

Team Description

Our Product team advocates for our users and our business, setting the vision for our growing family of products. We use data, research, strategy, and empathy to guide multidisciplinary teams toward a common goal, balancing diverse perspectives and empowering our teams to do great work. As we scale globally, there’s plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people around the world in team that always focuses on we, not I, and creates delightful products that are worthy of trust.

Role Description

We're looking for a Data Scientist to partner with revenue, marketing, and product teams to answer key questions about how to grow revenue, optimize product, scale and monetize the business, and launch high-impact initiatives. We solve challenging problems and boost business growth through a deep understanding of user behaviors with applied analytics techniques and business insights. An ideal candidate should have robust knowledge of consumer lifecycle and behavior analysis, customer segmentation, digital campaigns, monetization analytics and business operations for a SaaS company.
Responsibilities

Develop a deep understanding of customer journey phases and key business metrics
Perform analytical deep-dives to analyze problems and opportunities, identify the hypothesis and design & execute experiments
Inform future experimentation design and roadmaps by performing exploratory analysis to understand user engagement behavior and derive insights
Create personalized segmentation strategies leveraging propensity models to enable targeting of offers and experiences based on user attributes
Identify key trends and build automated reporting & executive-facing dashboards to track the progress of acquisition, monetization, and engagement trends.
Extract actionable insights through analyzing large, complex, multi-dimensional customer behavior data sets
Monitor and analyze a high volume of experiments designed to optimize the product for user experience and revenue & promote best practices for multivariate experiments
Translate complex concepts into implications for the business via excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Understand what matters most and prioritize ruthlessly
Work with cross-functional teams (including Data Science, Marketing, Product, Engineering, Design, User Research, and senior executives) to rapidly execute and iterate
Requirements

Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
3-5 years experience using analytics to drive key business decisions; examples include business/product/marketing analytics, business intelligence, strategy consulting
Proven track record of being able to work independently and proactively engage with business stakeholders with minimal direction
Significant experience with SQL and large unstructured datasets such as Hadoop
Deep understanding of statistical analysis, experimentation design, and common analytical techniques like regression, decision trees
Solid background in running multivariate experiments to optimize a product or revenue flow
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in programming/scripting and knowledge of statistical packages like R or Python is a plus

Total Rewards

Austin (TX) metro, Chicago metro, Colorado, Massachusetts, Maryland, Oregon, Washington D.C. metro, California (outside SF metro), the expected salary/On-Target Earnings (OTE) range for the role is currently $139,200 - $163,800 - $188,400.

Arizona, Florida, Georgia, Illinois (outside Chicago Metro), North Carolina, Tennessee, Texas (outside Austin Metro), Virginia (outside D.C. Metro), the expected salary/On-Target Earnings (OTE) range for the role is currently $123,800 - $145,600 - $167,400.

Range(s) is subject to change. Dropbox takes a number of factors into account when determining individual starting pay, including job and level they are hired into, location/metropolitan area, skillset, and peer compensation. Dropbox uses the zip code of an employee’s remote work location to determine which metropolitan pay range we use.

Salary/OTE is just one component of Dropbox’s total rewards package. All regular employees are also eligible for the corporate bonus program or a sales incentive (target included in OTE) as well as stock in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs).

Dropbox is committed to investing in the holistic health and wellbeing of all Dropboxers and their families. Our benefits and perks programs include, but are not limited to:

Parental benefits including; Parental Leave, Child and Adult Care, Day Care FSA (US Only), Fertility Benefits (US Only), Adoption and Surrogacy support and Lactation Support

Mental Health and Wellness benefits Free Dropbox space for your friends and family

Additional benefits details are available upon request.

About CoVar

About this position

Deep understanding of machine learning fundamentals (gradient descent, cross-validation, ROC curves, confusion matrices) are necessary. Knowledge of classical machine learning (e.g., support-vector-machines, logistic regression) are valued. We are now continuing to build on our goal of providing more choice for consumers and a premium, better-than-linear TV brand experience for advertisers. That said, we are looking for the founding members of this new business area for Netflix!

The Ads Data Science and Engineering team at Netflix’s mission is to help build the foundation of the ads business at Netflix. We conduct analyses and develop analytic tools, build predictive models and algorithms using machine learning, all with the goal of creating more choices and joy for our members. You’ll work closely with partner teams to build workflows, provide recommendations and drive success on end-to-end analytics initiatives in this 0 -1 space.

Near-Miss Management (NMM) is seeking a talented and highly motivated Senior Data Scientist to further develop and scale its unique web-based data analytics platform. NMM provides powerful analytics software, based on machine learning and AI, to the chemical and energy industry – to improve reliability, and minimize failures and losses.
Within our engineering team, your voice will be a valuable asset to product development. You will be in a unique position to define/undertake technical needs of the software and help shape the future of its technology. You will enjoy an intellectually creative atmosphere as you work with an experienced and enthusiastic team that strives continuously to build and deliver a robust, reliable software system.
Responsibilities
One of the main responsibilities of this role is development of a new flagship product in Python using the Scipy/Numpy/Pandas stack. Further, you will be responsible for leading our efforts in improvement of existing data analytics and machine-learning models (implemented in Python using the Scipy/Numpy/Pandas stack). Aside from analytics, another important aspect of the role involves enhancement of the existing processing pipeline, which executes the analytics in a parallelized and distributed fashion – you will assist in refining that pipeline on an ongoing basis as new features and products are developed.

What we do
At Civis Analytics, we bring objective, data-driven truth to organizational decision-making—from the boardroom to the world's largest social causes.
This mission isn't an aspiration: it's something we see realized every day, and it brings purpose to everything we're working on.
We combine a sophisticated SaaS product with our specialized data science consultancy to empower tens of thousands of active users to make millions of data-driven decisions every month. From joining disparate data sources and automating reporting, to building more elaborate models of targeted audiences and optimizing messages for them, organizations like the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, the City of Boston, and iHeart Radio trust Civis's technology to make their most critical decisions.

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Lead Data Scientist - Digital & Data Science Group - JJSC located in listed locations or Remote.
Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We adopt research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.
With $82.6 billion in 2020 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly- based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 260 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 135,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.

Job Title: Data Scientist/Fraud/Corruption Data Analyst - Department of Justice
Job Description:
Cambio Consulting Group LLC is seeking to hire a full-time Data Scientist/Fraud/Corruption data analytics for a contract with the Criminal Division of the U.S. Department of Justice. Must have a minimum of a Bachelor's Degree and 5+ years of experience.
Must have good understanding in building data analytics programs and programming languages: SQL, Excel, SAS, Python, R, C++ or Java.
Working closely with US attorneys, FBI agents, and forensic accountants, the Data Scientist will pull, normalize, and smash data from multiple data sources (including government, external, and corporation accounting systems), develop and apply learning algorithms to assist in the analysis of the data, and build user interface and user workflows for attorneys and agents to gain insight.

The primary responsibilities of this position are to provide statistical consulting to clients in the biotech/pharmaceutical industry in their drug development programs with a focus on protocol/study design, analysis planning, regulatory submission strategies, regulatory communication, mento ring of other statisticians in generating analyses for clinical studies and regulatory submissions and assist with business proposals. This position assumes a supervision responsibility on statistical personnel and job training.

Essential Job Functions:
Provides statistical consulting to clinical study design.
Reviews study protocols and writes statistical sections.
Conducts sample size and power calculations.
Proposes randomization methods and designs.

Job Summary
Galapagos Federal Systems LLC is looking for an enthusiastic, well-qualified individual to fill Space Domain Awareness (SDA) and Data Fusion Systems Program Manager supporting the Space Domain Awareness (SDA) Analytics and Artificial Intelligence (AI) squadron within the SDA Acquisition Delta (SSC/SZG). Sitewise Analytics is a recognized, boutique, customer-centric company that has been on the North American commercial real estate scene providing predictive analytics software and solutions since 2012. Industry-leading corporations and franchisors partner with Sitewise Analytics to work out varied business questions from sales forecasting and sales impact assessment, to portfolio optimization and whitespace analysis. Clients include Burger King, Wingstop, Lululemon, The North Face, Aspen Dental, Banfield Pet Hospitals and many other organizations in the restaurant, retail and healthcare sectors.
This role will be based at Sitewise Analytics’ office in Plano, TX, along with other members of the Predictive Analytics Team. The Team uses a hybrid model of working from home and at the office. The company’s owners intentionally facilitate an extraordinary environment that engages employees to stretch, grow and deliver outstanding business support services to customers. At the heart of Sitewise Analytics is a nimble, diverse, motivated and passionate Predictive Analytics Team. The members of the team interact directly with decision-makers at several levels within client companies. Using a dynamic mix of machine learning approaches blended with classical statistical techniques and spatial analytics, the members of the team develop predictive models and provide strategic advice to decision-makers in customer organizations. As a result of successful growth, the Sitewise Analytics Team is delightfully expanding to include another Senior Predictive Modeler.

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our team and support ONI project initiatives. The successful candidate will be responsible for applying qualitative and quantitative methods to analyze and resolve analytical issues, as well as exploring opportunities for data acquisition and new uses for existing data. You will collaborate with government points of contact (POC) to perform data analyses, identify trends and patterns, and test hypotheses.
Responsibilities:
Apply qualitative and quantitative methods to analyze and resolve analytical issues in support of ONI project initiatives.
Research and identify opportunities for data acquisition and new data uses.
Collaborate with government POCs to perform exploratory and targeted data analyses, test hypotheses, and mine structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.

DATA SCIENTIST/ALGORITHM DEVELOPER
Raptor Scientific, a Global Aerospace & Defense Test and Measurement Company, is seeking an exceptional Engineer or Applied Mathematician with expertise in signal processing to join our dynamic team. You will have the opportunity to work on challenging projects that demand a deep understanding of signal processing algorithms and imaging techniques. Your expertise in handling I/Q data and proficiency in programming languages such as C, C#, and MATLAB will be instrumental in driving our technological advancements. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in developing and optimizing advanced technologies that will enhance the performance and capabilities of our mission-critical aerospace and defense systems.
As part of the Raptor Scientific Family, the RF Systems (RFS) group specializes in radar cross section (RCS) measurements and is constantly innovating to produce the next generation of radar systems. RFS has a multifaceted team that develops cutting edge measurement systems in support of the Aerospace and Defense industry. Our team is focused on customer needs and providing full spectrum support including engineering, field measurement, software development and manufacturing.

InnoCape, LLC is seeking a Data Architect to join our team in Norfolk, VA working with our client, NATO ACT. The Data Architect will work within the Computer Information Systems (CIS) Core Services (CS) team reporting to the CS Programme Director. In functional terms, the contractor will work closely with ACT’s Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (AI) Section taking guidance and joining data forums and activities as necessary. This support is required to ensure that a solid base of specialist and corporate knowledge is available covering the extensive processes and procedures within the CS area. Thus, the team member will contribute to the development of the NATO Digital Backbone and NATO’s Data Exploitation initiative through:
a. Reviews of legacy data flows and models undertaking analysis to propose rationalisation of data in accordance with NATO policies and initiatives.
b. Elicits and documents artefacts including conducting impact assessments and developing trace matrices.

Machine Learning Engineer
About CoVar
CoVar is a small AI/ML R&D software company in Durham, NC, that uses artificial intelligence to solve problems that matter. We develop AI/ML tools to help the DoD detect enemies and threats, help biomedical researchers find new cures for diseases, and help monitor machinery to prevent injuries and environmental catastrophes. We are passionate engineers, dedicated to pushing the bounds of what AI/ML can do in the real world.
About this position
You will help CoVar develop software and machine learning algorithms to solve real-world customer problems. You will work with data, develop algorithms, evaluate results, and write the production code that goes onto real-world systems. You will have the opportunity to present your work to high-level customers in the DoD and in the industry. The position includes opportunities to publish novel work in both classified and unclassified settings.

Applicants should have expertise in Python (including NumPy, pandas, and other packages) and either PyTorch or TensorFlow. Deep understanding of machine learning fundamentals (gradient descent, cross-validation, ROC curves, confusion matrices) are necessary. Knowledge of classical machine learning (e.g., support-vector-machines, logistic regression) are valued. Applicants are ideally familiar with computer vision algorithms like object detection networks (e.g., YOLO, CenterNet) and modern image classification techniques. Previous experience with DoD customers is a plus.

The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will support the Department of State (DOS) Center for Analytics (CfA) in a dynamic role that may evolve over time, as the organizational needs change. The DOS Chief Data Scientist has a broad set of responsibilities and duties that require support from a professional and technical staff, of which the Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist a senior member. The primary responsibility of the Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will be to support the Chief Data Scientist as advisor, subject matter expert, and surrogate in meetings, working groups, and technical environments. The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will evaluate data science projects, provide recommendations and improvements to the Chief Data Scientist and/or analytics project staff, working closely with them to implement improvements as necessary.
The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will evaluate, recommend, and support the implementation of technology stack and software toolset optimizations and additions. The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist lead or independently execute analytics projects, as needed. The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will provide expert input on Large Language Models (LLM), Natural Language Processing (NLP), Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML), data science models, and other technical topics.

Flinn Scientific, the industry leader in enabling science teachers to educate young minds in both the US and Canada is seeking a data-driven, critical-thinking, and experienced Senior Marketing Data Analyst to join our team. Big Picture View
Do you geek out over data? Do you thrive on reporting KPI and metric performance? Our Senior Marketing Data Analyst is responsible for more than simply creating and running reports, you’re helping us define requirements and understanding our business data at a deeper level to assist our Sales & Marketing teams with making data-driven decisions. Handling large volumes of data excites you, building meaningful reports and interpreting the output is something you are extremely skilled at. Proficient in a variety of data platforms and tools, you are detail-oriented with a passion for data and accuracy. In this role, you will gain exposure to a hybrid B2B/B2C environment where you can learn and influence different commercial and customer business strategies.

At Fulcrum, we provide cutting-edge data science consulting and software solutions to help companies solve challenging business problems. Through the utilization of our innovative products and dedicated team, clients are able to operate more efficiently, manage risk, and make informed business decisions every day. Fulcrum Analytics has stood at the forefront of data, analytics, and innovative software for over 25 years, offering sophisticated solutions, groundbreaking technologies, and winning strategies that help companies achieve their targeted results.

The Data Scientist role is expected to develop analytical, statistical, and machine learning solutions to client business problems. The Data Scientist will have a number of responsibilities, including:
Extract and manipulate data from various sources (databases, files, APIs, etc.); requires knowledge of how to deal with the inherent structure of the data.

About Walgreens and WBA

Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170-year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide.

About Us:
At Parafin, our mission is to grow small businesses. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, yet banks do not have their back. Parafin is a technology company that builds infrastructure which enables small businesses to get easy access to financial services via platforms they sell on.

Parafin's first product offers capital-as-a-service for online platforms. Parafin currently powers the capital programs of platforms ranging from Series B to post-IPO companies such as DoorDash, Amazon, and Worldpay. We are a tight-knit team of engineers and designers, coming from organizations such as Stripe, Square, Plaid, Coinbase, Robinhood, Affirm, Uber, and CERN, and are excited both about helping hundreds of thousands of small businesses grow and thrive, and building products that leaders at top companies have started to use every day.

We are backed by prominent venture capitalists such as Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, GIC, Index Ventures, Green Oaks Capital, and SV Angel.

Develop, test, and deploy predictive models to identify areas of improvement and risk within hospital care.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate your findings and models into the Hospital Quality Reporting system.

Level 3: 8 or more years of experience, relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals, independently performs a variety of complicated tasks, may lead and direct the work of others, a wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.II. Minimum Requirements:

The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will support the Department of State (DOS) Center for Analytics (CfA) in a dynamic role that may evolve over time, as the organizational needs change. The DOS Chief Data Scientist has a broad set of responsibilities and duties that require support from a professional and technical staff, of which the Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist a senior member. The primary responsibility of the Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will be to support the Chief Data Scientist as advisor, subject matter expert, and surrogate in meetings, working groups, and technical environments. The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will evaluate data science projects, provide recommendations and improvements to the Chief Data Scientist and/or analytics project staff, working closely with them to implement improvements as necessary.
The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will evaluate, recommend, and support the implementation of technology stack and software toolset optimizations and additions. The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist lead or independently execute analytics projects, as needed. The Senior Data Scientist/Methodologist will provide expert input on Large Language Models (LLM), Natural Language Processing (NLP), Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML), data science models, and other technical topics.

Sitewise Analytics is a recognized, boutique, customer-centric company that has been on the North American commercial real estate scene providing predictive analytics software and solutions since 2012. Industry-leading corporations and franchisors partner with Sitewise Analytics to work out varied business questions from sales forecasting and sales impact assessment, to portfolio optimization and whitespace analysis. Clients include Burger King, Wingstop, Lululemon, The North Face, Aspen Dental, Banfield Pet Hospitals and many other organizations in the restaurant, retail and healthcare sectors.
This role will be based at Sitewise Analytics’ office in Plano, TX, along with other members of the Predictive Analytics Team. The Team uses a hybrid model of working from home and at the office. The company’s owners intentionally facilitate an extraordinary environment that engages employees to stretch, grow and deliver outstanding business support services to customers. At the heart of Sitewise Analytics is a nimble, diverse, motivated and passionate Predictive Analytics Team. The members of the team interact directly with decision-makers at several levels within client companies. Using a dynamic mix of machine learning approaches blended with classical statistical techniques and spatial analytics, the members of the team develop predictive models and provide strategic advice to decision-makers in customer organizations. As a result of successful growth, the Sitewise Analytics Team is delightfully expanding to include another Senior Predictive Modeler.

Flinn Scientific, the industry leader in enabling science teachers to educate young minds in both the US and Canada is seeking a data-driven, critical-thinking, and experienced Senior Marketing Data Analyst to join our team. If you are a technical and analytical problem solver, who is eager to work with our internal stakeholders to provide reporting with actionable insights, then we want to talk with you!
Big Picture View
Do you geek out over data? Do you thrive on reporting KPI and metric performance? Our Senior Marketing Data Analyst is responsible for more than simply creating and running reports, you’re helping us define requirements and understanding our business data at a deeper level to assist our Sales & Marketing teams with making data-driven decisions. Handling large volumes of data excites you, building meaningful reports and interpreting the output is something you are extremely skilled at. Proficient in a variety of data platforms and tools, you are detail-oriented with a passion for data and accuracy. In this role, you will gain exposure to a hybrid B2B/B2C environment where you can learn and influence different commercial and customer business strategies.

Job Title: Signal Processing and Machine Learning Engineer
Job Description:
Signal Systems Corporation (SSC) is searching for Machine Learning Engineers to support the development of next generation sonar systems and sonar signal processing algorithms for a range of underwater applications. SSC has a 25-year history of leveraging its institutional and individual expertise in distributed acoustic sensors, active noise control, acoustic surveillance, machine learning, audio enhancement and interference rejection to provide innovative engineering solutions for both government and commercial customers.
Job Description/Responsibilities:
Design and develop machine learning and supporting signal processing algorithms for detection, estimation, and classification on active and passive acoustic sensor data.
Build large datasets, test machine learning models, and incorporate trained models into larger software products.

InnoCape, LLC is seeking a Data Architect to join our team in Norfolk, VA working with our client, NATO ACT. The Data Architect will work within the Computer Information Systems (CIS) Core Services (CS) team reporting to the CS Programme Director. In functional terms, the contractor will work closely with ACT’s Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (AI) Section taking guidance and joining data forums and activities as necessary. This support is required to ensure that a solid base of specialist and corporate knowledge is available covering the extensive processes and procedures within the CS area. Thus, the team member will contribute to the development of the NATO Digital Backbone and NATO’s Data Exploitation initiative through:
a. Reviews of legacy data flows and models undertaking analysis to propose rationalisation of data in accordance with NATO policies and initiatives.
b. Elicits and documents artefacts including conducting impact assessments and developing trace matrices.

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our team and support ONI project initiatives. The successful candidate will be responsible for applying qualitative and quantitative methods to analyze and resolve analytical issues, as well as exploring opportunities for data acquisition and new uses for existing data. You will collaborate with government points of contact (POC) to perform data analyses, identify trends and patterns, and test hypotheses.
Responsibilities:
Apply qualitative and quantitative methods to analyze and resolve analytical issues in support of ONI project initiatives.
Research and identify opportunities for data acquisition and new data uses.
Collaborate with government POCs to perform exploratory and targeted data analyses, test hypotheses, and mine structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.

DATA SCIENTIST/ALGORITHM DEVELOPER
Raptor Scientific, a Global Aerospace & Defense Test and Measurement Company, is seeking an exceptional Engineer or Applied Mathematician with expertise in signal processing to join our dynamic team. You will have the opportunity to work on challenging projects that demand a deep understanding of signal processing algorithms and imaging techniques. Your expertise in handling I/Q data and proficiency in programming languages such as C, C#, and MATLAB will be instrumental in driving our technological advancements. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in developing and optimizing advanced technologies that will enhance the performance and capabilities of our mission-critical aerospace and defense systems.
As part of the Raptor Scientific Family, the RF Systems (RFS) group specializes in radar cross section (RCS) measurements and is constantly innovating to produce the next generation of radar systems. RFS has a multifaceted team that develops cutting edge measurement systems in support of the Aerospace and Defense industry. Our team is focused on customer needs and providing full spectrum support including engineering, field measurement, software development and manufacturing.

Full Job Description
Do you have an active security clearance from the US government? Do you want to break into a fast growing technology company? Scale is hiring people with security clearances and training them to become Data Labeling Quality Specialists in the artificial intelligence and machine learning industry. This is an incredible opportunity to restart or accelerate your career if you have a security clearance and are a self-starter, detail-oriented, and adaptable.

Label machine learning data from customers
Complete tasks in a timely manner, meeting SLA deadlines

Great Innovations Data Scientist

Collecting data through means such as analyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studies
Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis

Machine Learning Engineer
About CoVar
CoVar is a small AI/ML R&D software company in Durham, NC, that uses artificial intelligence to solve problems that matter. We develop AI/ML tools to help the DoD detect enemies and threats, help biomedical researchers find new cures for diseases, and help monitor machinery to prevent injuries and environmental catastrophes. We are passionate engineers, dedicated to pushing the bounds of what AI/ML can do in the real world.
About this position
You will help CoVar develop software and machine learning algorithms to solve real-world customer problems. You will work with data, develop algorithms, evaluate results, and write the production code that goes onto real-world systems. You will have the opportunity to present your work to high-level customers in the DoD and in the industry. The position includes opportunities to publish novel work in both classified and unclassified settings.

Applicants should have expertise in Python (including NumPy, pandas, and other packages) and either PyTorch or TensorFlow. Deep understanding of machine learning fundamentals (gradient descent, cross-validation, ROC curves, confusion matrices) are necessary. Knowledge of classical machine learning (e.g., support-vector-machines, logistic regression) are valued. Applicants are ideally familiar with computer vision algorithms like object detection networks (e.g., YOLO, CenterNet) and modern image classification techniques. Previous experience with DoD customers is a plus.

Statistical Analyst
America's Integrity Society is a growing not for profit organization. AIS 's purpose and mission is to develop and provide effective and comprehensive solutions to support and advocate changes within the civil and criminal Justice systems. We are looking for a talented and dedicated Statistical Analyst to join our team and help lay the foundations for a truly equitable and integral judicial system for all.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop and assist in the creation of cognitive testing materials for Civil legal needs survey.
Preparation of statistical reports, including but not limited to monthly, quarterly, annual, and annual/annualized and reports.

Job Title: E-commerce Data Scientist - Health and Wellness - California REMOTE
Job Description:
THE ROLE: E-commerce Data Scientist
Stingray Direct, a dynamic and fast-growing e-commerce company, is seeking a skilled Ecommerce Data Scientist to join our team. We aim to optimize the customer experience and drive business growth by leveraging data and advanced analytics. A successful candidate will have extensive experience in analyzing key ecommerce and subscription metrics, conducting A/B tests, data modeling, and machine learning. Proficiency with Excel, SQL, Python, and Google Analytics is a must.
*
Requirements*
KEY E-COMMERCE DATA SCIENTIST RESPONSIBILITIES:
Design, manage, and interpret comprehensive analyses related to the customer lifecycle, focusing on key subscription and e-commerce metrics.

Near-Miss Management (NMM) is seeking a talented and highly motivated Senior Data Scientist to further develop and scale its unique web-based data analytics platform. NMM provides powerful analytics software, based on machine learning and AI, to the chemical and energy industry – to improve reliability, and minimize failures and losses.
Within our engineering team, your voice will be a valuable asset to product development. You will be in a unique position to define/undertake technical needs of the software and help shape the future of its technology. You will enjoy an intellectually creative atmosphere as you work with an experienced and enthusiastic team that strives continuously to build and deliver a robust, reliable software system.
Responsibilities
One of the main responsibilities of this role is development of a new flagship product in Python using the Scipy/Numpy/Pandas stack. Further, you will be responsible for leading our efforts in improvement of existing data analytics and machine-learning models (implemented in Python using the Scipy/Numpy/Pandas stack). Aside from analytics, another important aspect of the role involves enhancement of the existing processing pipeline, which executes the analytics in a parallelized and distributed fashion – you will assist in refining that pipeline on an ongoing basis as new features and products are developed.

Veteran Engineering and Technology, LLC (VET) requires a Data Scientist/Statistician to support the OFFICE OF PUBLIC AFFAIRS (OPA) MINORITY BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT AGENCY (MBDA)
The DOC/EDA provides the U.S. with programs and grants to develop economic opportunities. EDA was established under the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 (42 U.S.C. 3121), as amended, to generate jobs, help retain existing jobs, and stimulate industrial and commercial growth in economically distressed areas of the United States. EDA assistance is available to rural and urban areas of the Nation experiencing high unemployment, low income, or other severe economic distress. EDA is guided by the basic principle that distressed communities must be empowered to develop and implement their own economic development and revitalization strategies. Additional information about EDA and its programs can be found at www.eda.gov.

The Team:
At Client’s Artificial Intelligence Center of Excellence (AI COE), you won’t be just tinkering around the edges, you’ll be building critical solutions that will benefit our clients for years to come. Collect requirements and deliver high value AI/ML solutions that drive customer, shareholder, and business value. The AI COE houses some of the highest caliber scientists, mathematicians and statisticians who implement the use of rigorous AI & quantitative approaches to ensure that we are efficiently building algorithms and technology relevant to the business or customer experience issue at hand. Those of us who love to work with data see this as the pinnacle of opportunities that you cannot find anywhere else in the industry. We are looking for an experienced Data Science AI Engineer to join our team at client you will play a critical role in developing and fine-tuning AI models using the Vertex.AI platform. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in natural language processing (NLP), machine learning, and software engineering. Your expertise in AI prompt engineering, coupled with proficiency in the Vertex.AI platform, will be essential in creating high-quality AI models to enhance the capabilities of client.

About Us:
At Parafin, our mission is to grow small businesses. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, yet banks do not have their back. Parafin is a technology company that builds infrastructure which enables small businesses to get easy access to financial services via platforms they sell on.

Parafin's first product offers capital-as-a-service for online platforms. Parafin currently powers the capital programs of platforms ranging from Series B to post-IPO companies such as DoorDash, Amazon, and Worldpay. We are a tight-knit team of engineers and designers, coming from organizations such as Stripe, Square, Plaid, Coinbase, Robinhood, Affirm, Uber, and CERN, and are excited both about helping hundreds of thousands of small businesses grow and thrive, and building products that leaders at top companies have started to use every day.

We are backed by prominent venture capitalists such as Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, GIC, Index Ventures, Green Oaks Capital, and SV Angel.

Job Description

Intel is a company of bold and curious inventors and problem solvers who create some of the most astounding technology advancements and experiences in the world.

With a legacy of relentless innovation and a commitment to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth, our diverse and brilliant teams are continually searching for tomorrow's technology and revel in the challenge that changing the world for the better brings. We work every single day to design and manufacture silicon products that empower peoples digital lives.

Do you love to solve technical challenges that no one has solved yet? Do you enjoy working with cross functional teams to deliver IP solutions for products that impact customers lives? If so, Come join us to do something wonderful.

We are looking for world class data engineers to help us build the future of technology.

It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. This position supplies Advisory and Assistance Services (A&AS) support moving science and technology efforts to real-world execution. Job Title: Data Scientist/Fraud/Corruption Data Analyst - Department of Justice
Job Description:
Cambio Consulting Group LLC is seeking to hire a full-time Data Scientist/Fraud/Corruption data analytics for a contract with the Criminal Division of the U.S. Department of Justice. Must have a minimum of a Bachelor's Degree and 5+ years of experience.
Must have good understanding in building data analytics programs and programming languages: SQL, Excel, SAS, Python, R, C++ or Java.
Working closely with US attorneys, FBI agents, and forensic accountants, the Data Scientist will pull, normalize, and smash data from multiple data sources (including government, external, and corporation accounting systems), develop and apply learning algorithms to assist in the analysis of the data, and build user interface and user workflows for attorneys and agents to gain insight.

Location: Las Vegas | On-Site
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to be one of the on-boarding leads for OPTX's core product in the gaming industry. The Senior Data Analyst will have a direct reporting relationship to the Vice President of Data Engineering and will work closely with the Company’s operational team in supporting and executing technical goals. The Senior Data Analyst will part of a talented local team of on-boarding leads.
As part of the on-boarding team, you will be leading the data integration effort for new OPTX properties. You will be gathering data definitions and data requirements via email and virtual meetings. You will leading the data validation effort and be part of the pre-release testing.

The primary responsibilities of this position are to provide statistical consulting to clients in the biotech/pharmaceutical industry in their drug development programs with a focus on protocol/study design, analysis planning, regulatory submission strategies, regulatory communication, mento ring of other statisticians in generating analyses for clinical studies and regulatory submissions and assist with business proposals. This position assumes a supervision responsibility on statistical personnel and job training.

Essential Job Functions:
Provides statistical consulting to clinical study design.
Reviews study protocols and writes statistical sections.
Conducts sample size and power calculations.
Proposes randomization methods and designs.

Description
Seeking a Data Scientist with an active Secret Clearance to support a long-term data contract for the Special Operations Command (SOCOM).

We are seeking a dedicated Data Scientist to join our team working on the Hospital Quality Reporting system for the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS). The ideal candidate will be an analytical thinker with a deep understanding of healthcare data and its intricacies. Your work will play a pivotal role in improving the quality and effectiveness of healthcare services provided to millions of beneficiaries.

Analyze and interpret complex healthcare datasets to provide insights into hospital performance, patient outcomes, and care quality.

Near-Miss Management (NMM) is seeking a talented and highly motivated Senior Data Scientist to further develop and scale its unique web-based data analytics platform. NMM provides powerful analytics software, based on machine learning and AI, to the chemical and energy industry – to improve reliability, and minimize failures and losses.
Within our engineering team, your voice will be a valuable asset to product development. You will be in a unique position to define/undertake technical needs of the software and help shape the future of its technology. You will enjoy an intellectually creative atmosphere as you work with an experienced and enthusiastic team that strives continuously to build and deliver a robust, reliable software system.
Responsibilities
One of the main responsibilities of this role is development of a new flagship product in Python using the Scipy/Numpy/Pandas stack. Further, you will be responsible for leading our efforts in improvement of existing data analytics and machine-learning models (implemented in Python using the Scipy/Numpy/Pandas stack). Aside from analytics, another important aspect of the role involves enhancement of the existing processing pipeline, which executes the analytics in a parallelized and distributed fashion – you will assist in refining that pipeline on an ongoing basis as new features and products are developed.

The DOC/EDA provides the U.S. with programs and grants to develop economic opportunities. EDA was established under the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 (42 U.S.C. 3121), as amended, to generate jobs, help retain existing jobs, and stimulate industrial and commercial growth in economically distressed areas of the United States. EDA assistance is available to rural and urban areas of the Nation experiencing high unemployment, low income, or other severe economic distress. EDA is guided by the basic principle that distressed communities must be empowered to develop and implement their own economic development and revitalization strategies. Additional information about EDA and its programs can be found at www.eda.gov.

This role is responsible for developing and leading the implementation of Thrivent’s data-science capability and applying it to produce enterprise-level insights to significantly grow Thrivent’s membership. It leads a function that directly supports key corporate strategies and tactics, through producing insights that inform and influence company mission, definition of target market, marketing strategy, product development, customer experience design. To provide these insights, this role leads a team that uses advanced analytic, predictive, and big data techniques and tools. In order to lead this function effectively, the person in this role must be an expert in the appropriate areas, methods, and tools. Since these techniques and tools are rapidly evolving, the role must lead the function in not only applying current versions of these techniques and tools to produce insights, but also in continuously learning and applying the latest techniques in these evolving areas. The person in this role must form strong, trust-based relationships with leaders across the organization, and influence them, in the context of these strong relationships, to act on relevant insights produced by the data-science function.

Must have good understanding in building data analytics programs and programming languages: SQL, Excel, SAS, Python, R, C++ or Java.

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our team and support ONI project initiatives. The successful candidate will be responsible for applying qualitative and quantitative methods to analyze and resolve analytical issues, as well as exploring opportunities for data acquisition and new uses for existing data. Research and identify opportunities for data acquisition and new data uses.
Collaborate with government POCs to perform exploratory and targeted data analyses, test hypotheses, and mine structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.
